title: How Many Calories in 1 Shot of Vodka?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in 1 shot of vodka, including alcohol content, carbs, and tweaks for different proofs or flavors to fit your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Shot of Vodka?
assumptions: Standard 1.5 oz (44 ml) serving of unflavored, 80-proof (40% ABV) vodka.
disclaimer: Calories vary by brand, proof, serving size, and any mixers; alcohol provides empty calories. Check labels and drink responsibly.

quick_answer.text: One standard shot of 80-proof vodka has about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a standard shot of vodka?
faqs.a: About 97 calories for 1.5 oz of 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugars?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories—e.g., 100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in vodka besides calories?
faqs.a: No protein, fat, fiber, or significant vitamins; it's empty calories from ethanol.

faqs.q: What if I mix vodka with soda or juice?
faqs.a: Mixers add extra calories—e.g., tonic water can add 30-50 kcal per shot.
